column2:
"Yes, I am Luther.
But who might you be, to address me so?"
"There aren't many who would know me by both face and name..."

"...Unless, of course, you are a
spy... working for Lutz."

"Brother! Surely you jest!
This noble soul saved me when I was
pursued by his men!"
"You lack foresight, Harriet. Did you never consider that this could be part of a greater scheme? Perhaps to follow us home, and find our hideout..."
"Brother!"
"I understand, I understand. Please calm down. The crown princess should not raise her voice like that."

"The same goes to you,
my older brother."

"My claim to the throne is long
passed. I no longer have an
underlying royal duty to bind my
thoughts, actions, or the subjects
of my research."

"I see! This must be what
Alma was talking about!"
"It's like the records of what has been have all been messed up. Since this is basically a dream, anything within the boundaries of possibility can become a reality!"
"But... Luther as Harriet's brother? This exceeds all rational notions of plausibility..."

"Hey! Watch out!
What're you doing?!"

"Hmm... a fairy?
Just like the fabled legend..."

"Then you must be... a savior from
another world. Just as it has been
foretold."
"S-so, you understand!?"
"I am the forerunner of magical research. Were I to study the ebb and flow of mana around you, it would be noticeably different. After all, you are not from our world."
"That position allowed me to lay the foundations for modern summoning spells. I would never have made it to that point without believing in the existence of other worlds, now would I?"

"Nevertheless, you can both fly,
and understand speech?"

"Truly a creature of legend...
How fascinating!"
"If you wouldn't mind, might you indulge my studious passions and become the subject of my research?"

"Even if he's in an alternate universe,
he's practically the same person!"

"Hey! Listen!
Please, help meee!"
"1. Perhaps for another time."
"2. Please don't tease her."

"Hmm... very well.
Now, for our primary concern..."
"Oh, I'm quite serious... It appears my dear sister's sore gaze, however, does not take well to my words. Very well then, we shall proceed with our more pressing concern."

"Allow me to explain the current
state of affairs regarding our
country, and the effects of its civil war."
